verses.verseStringB: There was a group of My servants who used to say, `Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us, and have mercy on us; You are the Best of the merciful.’

verses.verseString: فَاتَّخَذْتُمُوهُمْ سِخْرِيًّا حَتَّىٰ أَنْسَوْكُمْ ذِكْرِي وَكُنْتُمْ مِنْهُمْ تَضْحَكُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But you made them a target of ridicule—until they made you forget My remembrance. And you used to laugh at them.

verses.verseString: إِنِّي جَزَيْتُهُمُ الْيَوْمَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا أَنَّهُمْ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Today, I have rewarded them for their endurance—they are the triumphant.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ كَمْ لَبِثْتُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ عَدَدَ سِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He will say, “How many years did you remain on earth?”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَبِثْنَا يَوْمًا أَوْ بَعْضَ يَوْمٍ فَاسْأَلِ الْعَادِّينَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say, “We remained a day, or part of a day. But ask those who keep count.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ إِنْ لَبِثْتُمْ إِلَّا قَلِيلًا ۖ لَوْ أَنَّكُمْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He will say, “You remained only for a little while—if you only knew.

verses.verseString: أَفَحَسِبْتُمْ أَنَّمَا خَلَقْنَاكُمْ عَبَثًا وَأَنَّكُمْ إِلَيْنَا لَا تُرْجَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Did you think that We created you in vain, and that to Us you will not be returned?”

verses.verseString: فَتَعَالَى اللَّهُ الْمَلِكُ الْحَقُّ ۖ لَا إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ الْعَرْشِ الْكَرِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: So Exalted is Allah, the True Sovereign. There is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يَدْعُ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ لَا بُرْهَانَ لَهُ بِهِ فَإِنَّمَا حِسَابُهُ عِنْدَ رَبِّهِ ۚ إِنَّهُ لَا يُفْلِحُ الْكَافِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Whoever calls upon another god with Allah—he has no proof thereof—his reckoning rests with his Lord. The disbelievers will not succeed.

verses.verseString: وَقُلْ رَبِّ اغْفِرْ وَارْحَمْ وَأَنْتَ خَيْرُ الرَّاحِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And say, “My Lord, forgive and have mercy, and You are the Best of the merciful.”

verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: سُورَةٌ أَنْزَلْنَاهَا وَفَرَضْنَاهَا وَأَنْزَلْنَا فِيهَا آيَاتٍ بَيِّنَاتٍ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: A chapter that We revealed, and made obligatory, and revealed in it Clear Verses, so that you may take notice.

verses.verseString: الزَّانِيَةُ وَالزَّانِي فَاجْلِدُوا كُلَّ وَاحِدٍ مِنْهُمَا مِائَةَ جَلْدَةٍ ۖ وَلَا تَأْخُذْكُمْ بِهِمَا رَأْفَةٌ فِي دِينِ اللَّهِ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَالْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ ۖ وَلْيَشْهَدْ عَذَابَهُمَا طَائِفَةٌ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The adulteress and the adulterer: whip each one of them a hundred lashes. And let no pity towards them overcome you regarding Allah’s Law—if you believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let their punishment be witnessed by a group of believers.

verses.verseString: الزَّانِي لَا يَنْكِحُ إِلَّا زَانِيَةً أَوْ مُشْرِكَةً وَالزَّانِيَةُ لَا يَنْكِحُهَا إِلَّا زَانٍ أَوْ مُشْرِكٌ ۚ وَحُرِّمَ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The adulterer shall marry none but an adulteress or an idolatress. And the adulteress shall marry none but an adulterer or an idolater. That is prohibited for believers.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ يَرْمُونَ الْمُحْصَنَاتِ ثُمَّ لَمْ يَأْتُوا بِأَرْبَعَةِ شُهَدَاءَ فَاجْلِدُوهُمْ ثَمَانِينَ جَلْدَةً وَلَا تَقْبَلُوا لَهُمْ شَهَادَةً أَبَدًا ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: As for those who accuse chaste women, and do not produce four witnesses, whip them eighty lashes. And never accept any testimony from them—these are the immoral.

verses.verseString: إِلَّا الَّذِينَ تَابُوا مِنْ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ وَأَصْلَحُوا فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Except those who repent afterward and reform—Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ يَرْمُونَ أَزْوَاجَهُمْ وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُمْ شُهَدَاءُ إِلَّا أَنْفُسُهُمْ فَشَهَادَةُ أَحَدِهِمْ أَرْبَعُ شَهَادَاتٍ بِاللَّهِ ۙ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: As for those who accuse their own wives, but have no witnesses except themselves, the testimony of one of them is equivalent to four testimonies, if he swears by Allah that he is truthful.

verses.verseString: وَالْخَامِسَةُ أَنَّ لَعْنَتَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهِ إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And the fifth time: that Allah’s curse be upon him: if he is a liar.

verses.verseString: وَيَدْرَأُ عَنْهَا الْعَذَابَ أَنْ تَشْهَدَ أَرْبَعَ شَهَادَاتٍ بِاللَّهِ ۙ إِنَّهُ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: But the punishment shall be averted from her, if she swears four times by Allah, that he is a liar.

verses.verseString: وَالْخَامِسَةَ أَنَّ غَضَبَ اللَّهِ عَلَيْهَا إِنْ كَانَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And the fifth time: that Allah’s wrath be upon her: if he is truthful.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ تَوَّابٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Were it not for Allah’s favor upon you, and His mercy, and that Allah is Acceptor of repentance and Wise.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ جَاءُوا بِالْإِفْكِ عُصْبَةٌ مِنْكُمْ ۚ لَا تَحْسَبُوهُ شَرًّا لَكُمْ ۖ بَلْ هُوَ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ ۚ لِكُلِّ امْرِئٍ مِنْهُمْ مَا اكْتَسَبَ مِنَ الْإِثْمِ ۚ وَالَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ كِبْرَهُ مِنْهُمْ لَهُ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Those who perpetrated the slander were a bunch of you. Do not consider it bad for you, but it is good for you. Each person among them bears his share in the sin. As for him who played the major role: for him is a terrible punishment.

verses.verseString: لَوْلَا إِذْ سَمِعْتُمُوهُ ظَنَّ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ وَالْمُؤْمِنَاتُ بِأَنْفُسِهِمْ خَيْرًا وَقَالُوا هَٰذَا إِفْكٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: If only, when you heard it, the believing men and believing women thought well of one another, and said, “This is an obvious lie.”

verses.verseString: لَوْلَا جَاءُوا عَلَيْهِ بِأَرْبَعَةِ شُهَدَاءَ ۚ فَإِذْ لَمْ يَأْتُوا بِالشُّهَدَاءِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ هُمُ الْكَاذِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Why did they not produce four witnesses? If they do not produce the witnesses, then in Allah’s sight, they are liars.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ لَمَسَّكُمْ فِي مَا أَفَضْتُمْ فِيهِ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Were it not for Allah’s grace upon you, and His mercy, in this world and the Hereafter, you would have suffered a great punishment for what you ventured into.

verses.verseString: إِذْ تَلَقَّوْنَهُ بِأَلْسِنَتِكُمْ وَتَقُولُونَ بِأَفْوَاهِكُمْ مَا لَيْسَ لَكُمْ بِهِ عِلْمٌ وَتَحْسَبُونَهُ هَيِّنًا وَهُوَ عِنْدَ اللَّهِ عَظِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: When you passed it from one tongue to another, and you said with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, and you considered it trivial, but according to Allah, it is very serious.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْلَا إِذْ سَمِعْتُمُوهُ قُلْتُمْ مَا يَكُونُ لَنَا أَنْ نَتَكَلَّمَ بِهَٰذَا سُبْحَانَكَ هَٰذَا بُهْتَانٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: If only, upon hearing it, you said, “It is not for us to repeat this. Glory be to You, this is a heinous slander.”

verses.verseString: يَعِظُكُمُ اللَّهُ أَنْ تَعُودُوا لِمِثْلِهِ أَبَدًا إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Allah cautions you never to return to the like of it—if you are believers.

verses.verseString: وَيُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Allah explains the Revelations to you. Allah is Knowing and Wise.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يُحِبُّونَ أَنْ تَشِيعَ الْفَاحِشَةُ فِي الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ وَأَنْتُمْ لَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Those who love to see immorality spread among the believers—for them is a painful punishment, in this life and in the Hereafter. And Allah knows, and you do not know.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ وَأَنَّ اللَّهَ رَءُوفٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Were it not for Allah’s grace upon you, and His mercy, and that Allah is Clement and Merciful.

verses.verseString: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَتَّبِعُوا خُطُوَاتِ الشَّيْطَانِ ۚ وَمَنْ يَتَّبِعْ خُطُوَاتِ الشَّيْطَانِ فَإِنَّهُ يَأْمُرُ بِالْفَحْشَاءِ وَالْمُنْكَرِ ۚ وَلَوْلَا فَضْلُ اللَّهِ عَلَيْكُمْ وَرَحْمَتُهُ مَا زَكَىٰ مِنْكُمْ مِنْ أَحَدٍ أَبَدًا وَلَٰكِنَّ اللَّهَ يُزَكِّي مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: O you who believe! Do not follow the footsteps of Satan. Whoever follows Satan’s footsteps—he advocates indecency and wickedness. Were it not for Allah’s favor towards you, and His mercy, none of you would be pure, ever. But Allah purifies whom He wills. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

verses.verseString: وَلَا يَأْتَلِ أُولُو الْفَضْلِ مِنْكُمْ وَالسَّعَةِ أَنْ يُؤْتُوا أُولِي الْقُرْبَىٰ وَالْمَسَاكِينَ وَالْمُهَاجِرِينَ فِي سَبِيلِ اللَّهِ ۖ وَلْيَعْفُوا وَلْيَصْفَحُوا ۗ أَلَا تُحِبُّونَ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ ۗ وَاللَّهُ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Those among you who possess affluence and means should not refuse to give to the relatives, and the needy, and the emigrants in Allah’s way. And let them pardon. And let them overlook. Do you not love for Allah to forgive you? Allah is Pardoning and Merciful.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَرْمُونَ الْمُحْصَنَاتِ الْغَافِلَاتِ الْمُؤْمِنَاتِ لُعِنُوا فِي الدُّنْيَا وَالْآخِرَةِ وَلَهُمْ عَذَابٌ عَظِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Those who slander honorable, innocent, believing women are cursed in this life and in the Hereafter. And they will have a terrible punishment.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ تَشْهَدُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَلْسِنَتُهُمْ وَأَيْدِيهِمْ وَأَرْجُلُهُمْ بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: On the Day when their tongues, and their hands, and their feet will testify against them regarding what they used to do.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَئِذٍ يُوَفِّيهِمُ اللَّهُ دِينَهُمُ الْحَقَّ وَيَعْلَمُونَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ هُوَ الْحَقُّ الْمُبِينُ
verses.verseStringB: On that Day, Allah will pay them their just due in full, and they will know that Allah is the Evident Reality.

verses.verseString: الْخَبِيثَاتُ لِلْخَبِيثِينَ وَالْخَبِيثُونَ لِلْخَبِيثَاتِ ۖ وَالطَّيِّبَاتُ لِلطَّيِّبِينَ وَالطَّيِّبُونَ لِلطَّيِّبَاتِ ۚ أُولَٰئِكَ مُبَرَّءُونَ مِمَّا يَقُولُونَ ۖ لَهُمْ مَغْفِرَةٌ وَرِزْقٌ كَرِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Wicked women are for wicked men, and wicked men are for wicked women, and good women are for good men, and good men are for good women. These are acquitted of what they say. They will have forgiveness and a generous provision.

verses.verseString: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لَا تَدْخُلُوا بُيُوتًا غَيْرَ بُيُوتِكُمْ حَتَّىٰ تَسْتَأْنِسُوا وَتُسَلِّمُوا عَلَىٰ أَهْلِهَا ۚ ذَٰلِكُمْ خَيْرٌ لَكُمْ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَذَكَّرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: O you who believe! Do not enter houses other than your own, until you have asked for permission, and greeted their occupants. That is better for you; so that you may remember.

verses.verseString: فَإِنْ لَمْ تَجِدُوا فِيهَا أَحَدًا فَلَا تَدْخُلُوهَا حَتَّىٰ يُؤْذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ قِيلَ لَكُمُ ارْجِعُوا فَارْجِعُوا ۖ هُوَ أَزْكَىٰ لَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: And if you find no one in them, do not enter them until you are given permission. And if it is said to you, “Turn back,” then turn back. That is more proper for you. Allah is aware of what you do.

verses.verseString: لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَنْ تَدْخُلُوا بُيُوتًا غَيْرَ مَسْكُونَةٍ فِيهَا مَتَاعٌ لَكُمْ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَعْلَمُ مَا تُبْدُونَ وَمَا تَكْتُمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: There is no blame on you for entering public places, in which is something of benefit for you. Allah knows what you disclose and what you conceal.

verses.verseString: قُلْ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ يَغُضُّوا مِنْ أَبْصَارِهِمْ وَيَحْفَظُوا فُرُوجَهُمْ ۚ ذَٰلِكَ أَزْكَىٰ لَهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا يَصْنَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Tell the believing men to restrain their looks, and to guard their privates. That is purer for them. Allah is Aware of what they do.

verses.verseString: وَقُلْ لِلْمُؤْمِنَاتِ يَغْضُضْنَ مِنْ أَبْصَارِهِنَّ وَيَحْفَظْنَ فُرُوجَهُنَّ وَلَا يُبْدِينَ زِينَتَهُنَّ إِلَّا مَا ظَهَرَ مِنْهَا ۖ وَلْيَضْرِبْنَ بِخُمُرِهِنَّ عَلَىٰ جُيُوبِهِنَّ ۖ وَلَا يُبْدِينَ زِينَتَهُنَّ إِلَّا لِبُعُولَتِهِنَّ أَوْ آبَائِهِنَّ أَوْ آبَاءِ بُعُولَتِهِنَّ أَوْ أَبْنَائِهِنَّ أَوْ أَبْنَاءِ بُعُولَتِهِنَّ أَوْ إِخْوَانِهِنَّ أَوْ بَنِي إِخْوَانِهِنَّ أَوْ بَنِي أَخَوَاتِهِنَّ أَوْ نِسَائِهِنَّ أَوْ مَا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُهُنَّ أَوِ التَّابِعِينَ غَيْرِ أُولِي الْإِرْبَةِ مِنَ الرِّجَالِ أَوِ الطِّفْلِ الَّذِينَ لَمْ يَظْهَرُوا عَلَىٰ عَوْرَاتِ النِّسَاءِ ۖ وَلَا يَضْرِبْنَ بِأَرْجُلِهِنَّ لِيُعْلَمَ مَا يُخْفِينَ مِنْ زِينَتِهِنَّ ۚ وَتُوبُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ جَمِيعًا أَيُّهَ الْمُؤْمِنُونَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُفْلِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And tell the believing women to restrain their looks, and to guard their privates, and not display their beauty except what is apparent thereof, and to draw their coverings over their breasts, and not expose their beauty except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their fellow women, what their right hands possess, their male attendants who have no sexual desires, or children who are unaware of women’s nudity. And they should not strike their feet, drawing attention to their hidden beauty. And turn to Allah in repentance, all together, O believers, so that you may be successful.

verses.verseString: وَأَنْكِحُوا الْأَيَامَىٰ مِنْكُمْ وَالصَّالِحِينَ مِنْ عِبَادِكُمْ وَإِمَائِكُمْ ۚ إِنْ يَكُونُوا فُقَرَاءَ يُغْنِهِمُ اللَّهُ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ وَاسِعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: And wed those who are single among you. And those who are fit among your servants and maids. If they are poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty. Allah is All-Encompassing, All-Knowing.

verses.verseString: وَلْيَسْتَعْفِفِ الَّذِينَ لَا يَجِدُونَ نِكَاحًا حَتَّىٰ يُغْنِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَالَّذِينَ يَبْتَغُونَ الْكِتَابَ مِمَّا مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ فَكَاتِبُوهُمْ إِنْ عَلِمْتُمْ فِيهِمْ خَيْرًا ۖ وَآتُوهُمْ مِنْ مَالِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي آتَاكُمْ ۚ وَلَا تُكْرِهُوا فَتَيَاتِكُمْ عَلَى الْبِغَاءِ إِنْ أَرَدْنَ تَحَصُّنًا لِتَبْتَغُوا عَرَضَ الْحَيَاةِ الدُّنْيَا ۚ وَمَنْ يُكْرِهْهُنَّ فَإِنَّ اللَّهَ مِنْ بَعْدِ إِكْرَاهِهِنَّ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: And let those who cannot marry abstain, until Allah enriches them from His bounty. If any of your servants wish to be freed, grant them their wish, if you recognize goodness in them. And give them of Allah’s wealth, which he has given you. And do not compel your girls to prostitution, seeking the materials of this life, while they desire to remain chaste. Should anyone compel them—then after their compulsion, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا إِلَيْكُمْ آيَاتٍ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ وَمَثَلًا مِنَ الَّذِينَ خَلَوْا مِنْ قَبْلِكُمْ وَمَوْعِظَةً لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: We revealed to you clarifying revelations, along with examples of those who passed on before you, and advice for the righteous.

verses.verseString: اللَّهُ نُورُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ مَثَلُ نُورِهِ كَمِشْكَاةٍ فِيهَا مِصْبَاحٌ ۖ الْمِصْبَاحُ فِي زُجَاجَةٍ ۖ الزُّجَاجَةُ كَأَنَّهَا كَوْكَبٌ دُرِّيٌّ يُوقَدُ مِنْ شَجَرَةٍ مُبَارَكَةٍ زَيْتُونَةٍ لَا شَرْقِيَّةٍ وَلَا غَرْبِيَّةٍ يَكَادُ زَيْتُهَا يُضِيءُ وَلَوْ لَمْ تَمْسَسْهُ نَارٌ ۚ نُورٌ عَلَىٰ نُورٍ ۗ يَهْدِي اللَّهُ لِنُورِهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۚ وَيَضْرِبُ اللَّهُ الْأَمْثَالَ لِلنَّاسِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The parable of His light is that of a niche, in which is a lamp. The lamp is within a crystal. The crystal is like a brilliant planet, fueled by a blessed tree, an olive tree, neither eastern nor western. Its oil would almost illuminate, even if no fire has touched it. Light upon Light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents the parables to the people. And Allah knows everything.

verses.verseString: فِي بُيُوتٍ أَذِنَ اللَّهُ أَنْ تُرْفَعَ وَيُذْكَرَ فِيهَا اسْمُهُ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ فِيهَا بِالْغُدُوِّ وَالْآصَالِ
verses.verseStringB: In houses that Allah has permitted to be raised, and His name is celebrated there. He is glorified there, morning and evening.

verses.verseString: رِجَالٌ لَا تُلْهِيهِمْ تِجَارَةٌ وَلَا بَيْعٌ عَنْ ذِكْرِ اللَّهِ وَإِقَامِ الصَّلَاةِ وَإِيتَاءِ الزَّكَاةِ ۙ يَخَافُونَ يَوْمًا تَتَقَلَّبُ فِيهِ الْقُلُوبُ وَالْأَبْصَارُ
verses.verseStringB: By men who neither trade nor commerce distracts them from the remembrance of Allah, and from performing the prayers, and from giving charity. They fear a Day when hearts and sights are overturned.

verses.verseString: لِيَجْزِيَهُمُ اللَّهُ أَحْسَنَ مَا عَمِلُوا وَيَزِيدَهُمْ مِنْ فَضْلِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ يَرْزُقُ مَنْ يَشَاءُ بِغَيْرِ حِسَابٍ
verses.verseStringB: So that Allah may reward them according to the best of what they did, and increase them from His bounty. Allah provides for whom He wills without measure.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا أَعْمَالُهُمْ كَسَرَابٍ بِقِيعَةٍ يَحْسَبُهُ الظَّمْآنُ مَاءً حَتَّىٰ إِذَا جَاءَهُ لَمْ يَجِدْهُ شَيْئًا وَوَجَدَ اللَّهَ عِنْدَهُ فَوَفَّاهُ حِسَابَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَرِيعُ الْحِسَابِ
verses.verseStringB: As for those who disbelieve: their works are like a mirage in a desert. The thirsty imagines it as water. Until, when he has reached it, he finds it to be nothing, and he finds Allah with him, Who settles his account in full. Allah is quick in accounting.

verses.verseString: أَوْ كَظُلُمَاتٍ فِي بَحْرٍ لُجِّيٍّ يَغْشَاهُ مَوْجٌ مِنْ فَوْقِهِ مَوْجٌ مِنْ فَوْقِهِ سَحَابٌ ۚ ظُلُمَاتٌ بَعْضُهَا فَوْقَ بَعْضٍ إِذَا أَخْرَجَ يَدَهُ لَمْ يَكَدْ يَرَاهَا ۗ وَمَنْ لَمْ يَجْعَلِ اللَّهُ لَهُ نُورًا فَمَا لَهُ مِنْ نُورٍ
verses.verseStringB: Or like utter darkness in a vast ocean, covered by waves, above which are waves, above which is fog—darknesses, one above the other. If he brings out his hand, he can hardly see it. He to whom Allah has not granted a light has no light.

verses.verseString: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُ مَنْ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَالطَّيْرُ صَافَّاتٍ ۖ كُلٌّ قَدْ عَلِمَ صَلَاتَهُ وَتَسْبِيحَهُ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ بِمَا يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Do you not realize that Allah is glorified by whoever is in the heavens and on earth, even by the birds in formation? Each knows its manner of prayer and praise. Allah knows what they do.

verses.verseString: وَلِلَّهِ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ وَإِلَى اللَّهِ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.verseStringB: To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the final return.

verses.verseString: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ اللَّهَ يُزْجِي سَحَابًا ثُمَّ يُؤَلِّفُ بَيْنَهُ ثُمَّ يَجْعَلُهُ رُكَامًا فَتَرَى الْوَدْقَ يَخْرُجُ مِنْ خِلَالِهِ وَيُنَزِّلُ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مِنْ جِبَالٍ فِيهَا مِنْ بَرَدٍ فَيُصِيبُ بِهِ مَنْ يَشَاءُ وَيَصْرِفُهُ عَنْ مَنْ يَشَاءُ ۖ يَكَادُ سَنَا بَرْقِهِ يَذْهَبُ بِالْأَبْصَارِ
verses.verseStringB: Do you not see how Allah propels the clouds, then He joins them together, then He piles them into a heap, and you see raindrops pouring from its midst? How He brings down from the sky loads of hail, striking with it whom He wills, and averting it from whom He wills? The flash of its lightning nearly snatches the sight away.

verses.verseString: يُقَلِّبُ اللَّهُ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ ۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبْرَةً لِأُولِي الْأَبْصَارِ
verses.verseStringB: Allah alternates the night and the day. Surely in this is a lesson for people of insight.

verses.verseString: وَاللَّهُ خَلَقَ كُلَّ دَابَّةٍ مِنْ مَاءٍ ۖ فَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ بَطْنِهِ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ رِجْلَيْنِ وَمِنْهُمْ مَنْ يَمْشِي عَلَىٰ أَرْبَعٍ ۚ يَخْلُقُ اللَّهُ مَا يَشَاءُ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
verses.verseStringB: And Allah created every living creature from water. Some of them crawl on their bellies, and some walk on two legs, and some walk on four. Allah creates whatever He wills. Allah is Capable of everything.

verses.verseString: لَقَدْ أَنْزَلْنَا آيَاتٍ مُبَيِّنَاتٍ ۚ وَاللَّهُ يَهْدِي مَنْ يَشَاءُ إِلَىٰ صِرَاطٍ مُسْتَقِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: We sent down enlightening revelations, and Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

verses.verseString: وَيَقُولُونَ آمَنَّا بِاللَّهِ وَبِالرَّسُولِ وَأَطَعْنَا ثُمَّ يَتَوَلَّىٰ فَرِيقٌ مِنْهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ ذَٰلِكَ ۚ وَمَا أُولَٰئِكَ بِالْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And they say, “We have believed in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey.” Then some of them turn away thereafter. These are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ إِذَا فَرِيقٌ مِنْهُمْ مُعْرِضُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And when they are invited to Allah and His Messenger, to judge between them, some of them suddenly turn away.

verses.verseString: وَإِنْ يَكُنْ لَهُمُ الْحَقُّ يَأْتُوا إِلَيْهِ مُذْعِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: But if justice is on their side, they accept it willingly.

verses.verseString: أَفِي قُلُوبِهِمْ مَرَضٌ أَمِ ارْتَابُوا أَمْ يَخَافُونَ أَنْ يَحِيفَ اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِمْ وَرَسُولُهُ ۚ بَلْ أُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الظَّالِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or are they suspicious? Or do they fear that Allah may do them an injustice? Or His Messenger? In fact, they themselves are the unjust.

verses.verseString: إِنَّمَا كَانَ قَوْلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ إِذَا دُعُوا إِلَى اللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ لِيَحْكُمَ بَيْنَهُمْ أَنْ يَقُولُوا سَمِعْنَا وَأَطَعْنَا ۚ وَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْمُفْلِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The only response of the believers, when they are invited to Allah and His Messenger, to judge between them, is to say, “We hear and we obey.” It is they who are the achievers.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ يُطِعِ اللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُ وَيَخْشَ اللَّهَ وَيَتَّقْهِ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَائِزُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, and fears Allah and is conscious of Him—these are the winners.

verses.verseString: وَأَقْسَمُوا بِاللَّهِ جَهْدَ أَيْمَانِهِمْ لَئِنْ أَمَرْتَهُمْ لَيَخْرُجُنَّ ۖ قُلْ لَا تُقْسِمُوا ۖ طَاعَةٌ مَعْرُوفَةٌ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ خَبِيرٌ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And they swear by Allah with their most solemn oaths: if you were to command them, they would mobilize. Say, “Do not swear; obedience will be recognized; Allah is experienced with what you do.”

verses.verseString: قُلْ أَطِيعُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ ۖ فَإِنْ تَوَلَّوْا فَإِنَّمَا عَلَيْهِ مَا حُمِّلَ وَعَلَيْكُمْ مَا حُمِّلْتُمْ ۖ وَإِنْ تُطِيعُوهُ تَهْتَدُوا ۚ وَمَا عَلَى الرَّسُولِ إِلَّا الْبَلَاغُ الْمُبِينُ
verses.verseStringB: Say, “Obey Allah and obey the Messenger.” But if they turn away, then he is responsible for his obligations, and you are responsible for your obligations. But if you obey him, you will be guided. It is only incumbent on the Messenger to deliver the Message clearly.

verses.verseString: وَعَدَ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا مِنْكُمْ وَعَمِلُوا الصَّالِحَاتِ لَيَسْتَخْلِفَنَّهُمْ فِي الْأَرْضِ كَمَا اسْتَخْلَفَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ وَلَيُمَكِّنَنَّ لَهُمْ دِينَهُمُ الَّذِي ارْتَضَىٰ لَهُمْ وَلَيُبَدِّلَنَّهُمْ مِنْ بَعْدِ خَوْفِهِمْ أَمْنًا ۚ يَعْبُدُونَنِي لَا يُشْرِكُونَ بِي شَيْئًا ۚ وَمَنْ كَفَرَ بَعْدَ ذَٰلِكَ فَأُولَٰئِكَ هُمُ الْفَاسِقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Allah has promised those among you who believe and do good deeds, that He will make them successors on earth, as He made those before them successors, and He will strengthen their religion for them—which He has approved for them—and He will substitute security in place of their fear. They worship Me, associating nothing with Me. But whoever disbelieves thereafter—these are the rebellious.

verses.verseString: وَأَقِيمُوا الصَّلَاةَ وَآتُوا الزَّكَاةَ وَأَطِيعُوا الرَّسُولَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And pray regularly, and give charity regularly, and obey the Messenger, so that you may receive mercy.

verses.verseString: لَا تَحْسَبَنَّ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا مُعْجِزِينَ فِي الْأَرْضِ ۚ وَمَأْوَاهُمُ النَّارُ ۖ وَلَبِئْسَ الْمَصِيرُ
verses.verseStringB: Never think that those who disbelieve can escape on earth. Their housing is the Fire: a miserable destination.

verses.verseString: يَا أَيُّهَا الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا لِيَسْتَأْذِنْكُمُ الَّذِينَ مَلَكَتْ أَيْمَانُكُمْ وَالَّذِينَ لَمْ يَبْلُغُوا الْحُلُمَ مِنْكُمْ ثَلَاثَ مَرَّاتٍ ۚ مِنْ قَبْلِ صَلَاةِ الْفَجْرِ وَحِينَ تَضَعُونَ ثِيَابَكُمْ مِنَ الظَّهِيرَةِ وَمِنْ بَعْدِ صَلَاةِ الْعِشَاءِ ۚ ثَلَاثُ عَوْرَاتٍ لَكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ وَلَا عَلَيْهِمْ جُنَاحٌ بَعْدَهُنَّ ۚ طَوَّافُونَ عَلَيْكُمْ بَعْضُكُمْ عَلَىٰ بَعْضٍ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: O you who believe! Permission must be requested by your servants and those of you who have not reached puberty. On three occasions: before the Dawn Prayer, and at noon when you change your clothes, and after the Evening Prayer. These are three occasions of privacy for you. At other times, it is not wrong for you or them to intermingle with one another. Allah thus clarifies the revelations for you. Allah is Aware and Wise.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا بَلَغَ الْأَطْفَالُ مِنْكُمُ الْحُلُمَ فَلْيَسْتَأْذِنُوا كَمَا اسْتَأْذَنَ الَّذِينَ مِنْ قَبْلِهِمْ ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمْ آيَاتِهِ ۗ وَاللَّهُ عَلِيمٌ حَكِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: When the children among you reach puberty, they must ask permission, as those before them asked permission. Allah thus clarifies His revelations for you. Allah is Knowledgeable and Wise.

verses.verseString: وَالْقَوَاعِدُ مِنَ النِّسَاءِ اللَّاتِي لَا يَرْجُونَ نِكَاحًا فَلَيْسَ عَلَيْهِنَّ جُنَاحٌ أَنْ يَضَعْنَ ثِيَابَهُنَّ غَيْرَ مُتَبَرِّجَاتٍ بِزِينَةٍ ۖ وَأَنْ يَسْتَعْفِفْنَ خَيْرٌ لَهُنَّ ۗ وَاللَّهُ سَمِيعٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Women past the age of childbearing, who have no desire for marriage, commit no wrong by taking off their outer clothing, provided they do not flaunt their charm. But to maintain modesty is better for them. Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

verses.verseString: لَيْسَ عَلَى الْأَعْمَىٰ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْأَعْرَجِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَى الْمَرِيضِ حَرَجٌ وَلَا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِكُمْ أَنْ تَأْكُلُوا مِنْ بُيُوتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ آبَائِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أُمَّهَاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ إِخْوَانِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخَوَاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَعْمَامِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ عَمَّاتِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ أَخْوَالِكُمْ أَوْ بُيُوتِ خَالَاتِكُمْ أَوْ مَا مَلَكْتُمْ مَفَاتِحَهُ أَوْ صَدِيقِكُمْ ۚ لَيْسَ عَلَيْكُمْ جُنَاحٌ أَنْ تَأْكُلُوا جَمِيعًا أَوْ أَشْتَاتًا ۚ فَإِذَا دَخَلْتُمْ بُيُوتًا فَسَلِّمُوا عَلَىٰ أَنْفُسِكُمْ تَحِيَّةً مِنْ عِنْدِ اللَّهِ مُبَارَكَةً طَيِّبَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُبَيِّنُ اللَّهُ لَكُمُ الْآيَاتِ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: There is no blame on the blind, nor any blame on the disabled, nor any blame on the sick, nor on yourselves for eating at your homes, or your fathers’ homes, or your mothers’ homes, or your brothers’ homes, or your sisters’ homes, or the homes of your paternal uncles, or the homes of your paternal aunts, or the homes of your maternal uncles, or the homes of your maternal aunts, or those in your trust, or your friend’s. You commit no wrong by eating together or separately. But when you enter any home, greet one another with a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus Allah explains the revelations for you, so that you may understand.

verses.verseString: إِنَّمَا الْمُؤْمِنُونَ الَّذِينَ آمَنُوا بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ وَإِذَا كَانُوا مَعَهُ عَلَىٰ أَمْرٍ جَامِعٍ لَمْ يَذْهَبُوا حَتَّىٰ يَسْتَأْذِنُوهُ ۚ إِنَّ الَّذِينَ يَسْتَأْذِنُونَكَ أُولَٰئِكَ الَّذِينَ يُؤْمِنُونَ بِاللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِ ۚ فَإِذَا اسْتَأْذَنُوكَ لِبَعْضِ شَأْنِهِمْ فَأْذَنْ لِمَنْ شِئْتَ مِنْهُمْ وَاسْتَغْفِرْ لَهُمُ اللَّهَ ۚ إِنَّ اللَّهَ غَفُورٌ رَحِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: The believers are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him for a matter of common interest, they do not leave until they have asked him for permission. Those who ask your permission are those who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission to attend to some affair of theirs, give permission to any of them you wish, and ask Allah to forgive them. Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

verses.verseString: لَا تَجْعَلُوا دُعَاءَ الرَّسُولِ بَيْنَكُمْ كَدُعَاءِ بَعْضِكُمْ بَعْضًا ۚ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ اللَّهُ الَّذِينَ يَتَسَلَّلُونَ مِنْكُمْ لِوَاذًا ۚ فَلْيَحْذَرِ الَّذِينَ يُخَالِفُونَ عَنْ أَمْرِهِ أَنْ تُصِيبَهُمْ فِتْنَةٌ أَوْ يُصِيبَهُمْ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Do not address the Messenger, in the same manner, you address one another. Allah knows those of you who slip away using flimsy excuses. So let those who oppose his orders beware, lest an ordeal strikes them, or a painful punishment befalls them.

verses.verseString: أَلَا إِنَّ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۖ قَدْ يَعْلَمُ مَا أَنْتُمْ عَلَيْهِ وَيَوْمَ يُرْجَعُونَ إِلَيْهِ فَيُنَبِّئُهُمْ بِمَا عَمِلُوا ۗ وَاللَّهُ بِكُلِّ شَيْءٍ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: Know that to Allah belongs everything in the heavens and on earth. He knows what you stand for. And on the day they are returned to Him, He will inform them of what they did. Allah has full knowledge of all things.

verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي نَزَّلَ الْفُرْقَانَ عَلَىٰ عَبْدِهِ لِيَكُونَ لِلْعَالَمِينَ نَذِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion to His servant, that he may be a warner to humanity.

verses.verseString: الَّذِي لَهُ مُلْكُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَلَمْ يَتَّخِذْ وَلَدًا وَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُ شَرِيكٌ فِي الْمُلْكِ وَخَلَقَ كُلَّ شَيْءٍ فَقَدَّرَهُ تَقْدِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: He to whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, who took to Himself no son, who never had a partner in His sovereignty, who created everything and determined its measure.

verses.verseString: وَاتَّخَذُوا مِنْ دُونِهِ آلِهَةً لَا يَخْلُقُونَ شَيْئًا وَهُمْ يُخْلَقُونَ وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ لِأَنْفُسِهِمْ ضَرًّا وَلَا نَفْعًا وَلَا يَمْلِكُونَ مَوْتًا وَلَا حَيَاةً وَلَا نُشُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And yet, instead of Him, they produce for themselves gods that create nothing, but are themselves created; that have no power to harm or benefit them; that have no control over death, or life, or resurrection.

verses.verseString: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا إِفْكٌ افْتَرَاهُ وَأَعَانَهُ عَلَيْهِ قَوْمٌ آخَرُونَ ۖ فَقَدْ جَاءُوا ظُلْمًا وَزُورًا
verses.verseStringB: Those who disbelieve say, “This is nothing but a lie he fabricated, and others have helped him at it.” They have committed injustice and perjury.

verses.verseString: وَقَالُوا أَسَاطِيرُ الْأَوَّلِينَ اكْتَتَبَهَا فَهِيَ تُمْلَىٰ عَلَيْهِ بُكْرَةً وَأَصِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: And they say, “Legends of the ancients; he wrote them down; they are dictated to him morning and evening.”

verses.verseString: قُلْ أَنْزَلَهُ الَّذِي يَعْلَمُ السِّرَّ فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا
verses.verseStringB: Say, “It was revealed by He who knows the secret in the heavens and the earth. He is always Forgiving and Merciful.”

verses.verseString: وَقَالُوا مَالِ هَٰذَا الرَّسُولِ يَأْكُلُ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشِي فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۙ لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ إِلَيْهِ مَلَكٌ فَيَكُونَ مَعَهُ نَذِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And they say, “What sort of a messenger is this, who eats food, and walks in the marketplaces? If only an angel was sent down with him, to be alongside him a warner.”

verses.verseString: أَوْ يُلْقَىٰ إِلَيْهِ كَنْزٌ أَوْ تَكُونُ لَهُ جَنَّةٌ يَأْكُلُ مِنْهَا ۚ وَقَالَ الظَّالِمُونَ إِنْ تَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا رَجُلًا مَسْحُورًا
verses.verseStringB: Or, “If only a treasure was dropped on him.” Or, “If only he had a garden from which he eats.” The unjust also say, “You are only following a man under a spell.”

verses.verseString: انْظُرْ كَيْفَ ضَرَبُوا لَكَ الْأَمْثَالَ فَضَلُّوا فَلَا يَسْتَطِيعُونَ سَبِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Look how they invent examples for you. They have gone astray, and cannot find a way.

verses.verseString: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي إِنْ شَاءَ جَعَلَ لَكَ خَيْرًا مِنْ ذَٰلِكَ جَنَّاتٍ تَجْرِي مِنْ تَحْتِهَا الْأَنْهَارُ وَيَجْعَلْ لَكَ قُصُورًا
verses.verseStringB: Blessed is He, who, if He wills, can give you better than that: gardens beneath which rivers flow, and He will give you palaces.

verses.verseString: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا بِالسَّاعَةِ ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِمَنْ كَذَّبَ بِالسَّاعَةِ سَعِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: But they deny the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.

verses.verseString: إِذَا رَأَتْهُمْ مِنْ مَكَانٍ بَعِيدٍ سَمِعُوا لَهَا تَغَيُّظًا وَزَفِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: When it sees them from a distant place, they will hear it raging and roaring.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا أُلْقُوا مِنْهَا مَكَانًا ضَيِّقًا مُقَرَّنِينَ دَعَوْا هُنَالِكَ ثُبُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And when they are thrown into it, into a narrow place, shackled, they will plead there for death.

verses.verseString: لَا تَدْعُوا الْيَوْمَ ثُبُورًا وَاحِدًا وَادْعُوا ثُبُورًا كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: “Do not plead for one death today, but plead for a great many deaths.”

verses.verseString: قُلْ أَذَٰلِكَ خَيْرٌ أَمْ جَنَّةُ الْخُلْدِ الَّتِي وُعِدَ الْمُتَّقُونَ ۚ كَانَتْ لَهُمْ جَزَاءً وَمَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Say, “Is this better, or the Garden of Eternity promised to the cautious?” It is for them a reward and a destination.

verses.verseString: لَهُمْ فِيهَا مَا يَشَاءُونَ خَالِدِينَ ۚ كَانَ عَلَىٰ رَبِّكَ وَعْدًا مَسْئُولًا
verses.verseStringB: They will have there whatever they desire, forever. This is upon your Lord a binding promise.

verses.verseString: وَيَوْمَ يَحْشُرُهُمْ وَمَا يَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ فَيَقُولُ أَأَنْتُمْ أَضْلَلْتُمْ عِبَادِي هَٰؤُلَاءِ أَمْ هُمْ ضَلُّوا السَّبِيلَ
verses.verseStringB: On the Day when He gathers them, along with what they worshiped besides Allah, He will say, “Was it you who misled these servants of Mine, or was it they who lost the way?”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا سُبْحَانَكَ مَا كَانَ يَنْبَغِي لَنَا أَنْ نَتَّخِذَ مِنْ دُونِكَ مِنْ أَوْلِيَاءَ وَلَٰكِنْ مَتَّعْتَهُمْ وَآبَاءَهُمْ حَتَّىٰ نَسُوا الذِّكْرَ وَكَانُوا قَوْمًا بُورًا
verses.verseStringB: They will say, “Glory be to You. It was not for us to take any lords besides You. But you gave them enjoyments, and their ancestors, until they forgot the Remembrance and became ruined people.”

verses.verseString: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوكُمْ بِمَا تَقُولُونَ فَمَا تَسْتَطِيعُونَ صَرْفًا وَلَا نَصْرًا ۚ وَمَنْ يَظْلِمْ مِنْكُمْ نُذِقْهُ عَذَابًا كَبِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: They have denied you because of what you say; so you can neither avert, nor help. Whoever among you commits injustice, We will make him taste a horrible punishment.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَا قَبْلَكَ مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ إِلَّا إِنَّهُمْ لَيَأْكُلُونَ الطَّعَامَ وَيَمْشُونَ فِي الْأَسْوَاقِ ۗ وَجَعَلْنَا بَعْضَكُمْ لِبَعْضٍ فِتْنَةً أَتَصْبِرُونَ ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ بَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: We sent no messengers before you, but they ate food and walked in the marketplaces. And We made some of you a trial for one another—will you be patient? Your Lord is always Observing.

verses.verseString: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ لَا يَرْجُونَ لِقَاءَنَا لَوْلَا أُنْزِلَ عَلَيْنَا الْمَلَائِكَةُ أَوْ نَرَىٰ رَبَّنَا ۗ لَقَدِ اسْتَكْبَرُوا فِي أَنْفُسِهِمْ وَعَتَوْا عُتُوًّا كَبِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Those who do not expect to meet Us, say, “If only the angels were sent down to us, or we could see our Lord.” They have grown proud within themselves, and they have become excessively defiant.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَ الْمَلَائِكَةَ لَا بُشْرَىٰ يَوْمَئِذٍ لِلْمُجْرِمِينَ وَيَقُولُونَ حِجْرًا مَحْجُورًا
verses.verseStringB: On the Day when they see the angels—there will be no good news for the guilty on that Day; and they will say, “A forbidden ban!”

verses.verseString: وَقَدِمْنَا إِلَىٰ مَا عَمِلُوا مِنْ عَمَلٍ فَجَعَلْنَاهُ هَبَاءً مَنْثُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And We will proceed to their deeds, and We will reduce them to scattered dust.

verses.verseString: أَصْحَابُ الْجَنَّةِ يَوْمَئِذٍ خَيْرٌ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَأَحْسَنُ مَقِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: The inhabitants of Paradise on that Day will be better lodged, and most beautifully accommodated.

verses.verseString: وَيَوْمَ تَشَقَّقُ السَّمَاءُ بِالْغَمَامِ وَنُزِّلَ الْمَلَائِكَةُ تَنْزِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: On the Day when the sky will burst with clouds, and the angels are sent down in streams.

verses.verseString: الْمُلْكُ يَوْمَئِذٍ الْحَقُّ لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ ۚ وَكَانَ يَوْمًا عَلَى الْكَافِرِينَ عَسِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: On that Day, true sovereignty will belong to the Compassionate. And that will be a difficult Day for the unbelievers.

verses.verseString: وَيَوْمَ يَعَضُّ الظَّالِمُ عَلَىٰ يَدَيْهِ يَقُولُ يَا لَيْتَنِي اتَّخَذْتُ مَعَ الرَّسُولِ سَبِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: On that Day, the wrongdoer will bite his hands, and say, “If only I had followed a way with the Messenger.

verses.verseString: يَا وَيْلَتَىٰ لَيْتَنِي لَمْ أَتَّخِذْ فُلَانًا خَلِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Woe to me; I wish I never took so-and-so for a friend.

verses.verseString: لَقَدْ أَضَلَّنِي عَنِ الذِّكْرِ بَعْدَ إِذْ جَاءَنِي ۗ وَكَانَ الشَّيْطَانُ لِلْإِنْسَانِ خَذُولًا
verses.verseStringB: He led me away from the Message after it came to me, and Satan has always been a betrayer of man.”

verses.verseString: وَقَالَ الرَّسُولُ يَا رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي اتَّخَذُوا هَٰذَا الْقُرْآنَ مَهْجُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And the Messenger will say, “My Lord, my people have abandoned this Quran.”

verses.verseString: وَكَذَٰلِكَ جَعَلْنَا لِكُلِّ نَبِيٍّ عَدُوًّا مِنَ الْمُجْرِمِينَ ۗ وَكَفَىٰ بِرَبِّكَ هَادِيًا وَنَصِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Likewise, to every prophet We assign enemies from among the guilty. But your Lord suffices as a Guide and Helper.

verses.verseString: وَقَالَ الَّذِينَ كَفَرُوا لَوْلَا نُزِّلَ عَلَيْهِ الْقُرْآنُ جُمْلَةً وَاحِدَةً ۚ كَذَٰلِكَ لِنُثَبِّتَ بِهِ فُؤَادَكَ ۖ وَرَتَّلْنَاهُ تَرْتِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Those who disbelieve say, “Why was the Quran not revealed to him at once?” Thus to strengthen your heart with it, and We revealed it in stages.

verses.verseString: وَلَا يَأْتُونَكَ بِمَثَلٍ إِلَّا جِئْنَاكَ بِالْحَقِّ وَأَحْسَنَ تَفْسِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Whatever argument they come to you with, We provide you with the truth, and a better explanation.

verses.verseString: الَّذِينَ يُحْشَرُونَ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمْ إِلَىٰ جَهَنَّمَ أُولَٰئِكَ شَرٌّ مَكَانًا وَأَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Those who are herded into Hell on their faces—these are in a worse position, and further astray from the way.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ آتَيْنَا مُوسَى الْكِتَابَ وَجَعَلْنَا مَعَهُ أَخَاهُ هَارُونَ وَزِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: We gave Moses the Scripture, and We appointed his brother Aaron as a helper.

verses.verseString: فَقُلْنَا اذْهَبَا إِلَى الْقَوْمِ الَّذِينَ كَذَّبُوا بِآيَاتِنَا فَدَمَّرْنَاهُمْ تَدْمِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: We said, “Go to the people who rejected Our signs.” Then We destroyed them completely.

verses.verseString: وَقَوْمَ نُوحٍ لَمَّا كَذَّبُوا الرُّسُلَ أَغْرَقْنَاهُمْ وَجَعَلْنَاهُمْ لِلنَّاسِ آيَةً ۖ وَأَعْتَدْنَا لِلظَّالِمِينَ عَذَابًا أَلِيمًا
verses.verseStringB: And the people of Noah: when they rejected the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them a lesson for humanity. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

verses.verseString: وَعَادًا وَثَمُودَ وَأَصْحَابَ الرَّسِّ وَقُرُونًا بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And Aad, and Thamood, and the inhabitants of Arras, and many generations in between.

verses.verseString: وَكُلًّا ضَرَبْنَا لَهُ الْأَمْثَالَ ۖ وَكُلًّا تَبَّرْنَا تَتْبِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: To each, We presented the parables, and each We devastated utterly.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ أَتَوْا عَلَى الْقَرْيَةِ الَّتِي أُمْطِرَتْ مَطَرَ السَّوْءِ ۚ أَفَلَمْ يَكُونُوا يَرَوْنَهَا ۚ بَلْ كَانُوا لَا يَرْجُونَ نُشُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And they came upon the town that was drenched by the terrible rain. Did they not see it? But they do not hope for resurrection.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا رَأَوْكَ إِنْ يَتَّخِذُونَكَ إِلَّا هُزُوًا أَهَٰذَا الَّذِي بَعَثَ اللَّهُ رَسُولًا
verses.verseStringB: And when they see you, they take you for nothing but a joke: “Is this the one Allah sent as a messenger?”

verses.verseString: إِنْ كَادَ لَيُضِلُّنَا عَنْ آلِهَتِنَا لَوْلَا أَنْ صَبَرْنَا عَلَيْهَا ۚ وَسَوْفَ يَعْلَمُونَ حِينَ يَرَوْنَ الْعَذَابَ مَنْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: “He almost led us away from our gods, had we not adhered to them.” But they will know, when they see the suffering, who is further away from the way.

verses.verseString: أَرَأَيْتَ مَنِ اتَّخَذَ إِلَٰهَهُ هَوَاهُ أَفَأَنْتَ تَكُونُ عَلَيْهِ وَكِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Have you considered him who took his desire as his god? Would you be an agent for him?

verses.verseString: أَمْ تَحْسَبُ أَنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ يَسْمَعُونَ أَوْ يَعْقِلُونَ ۚ إِنْ هُمْ إِلَّا كَالْأَنْعَامِ ۖ بَلْ هُمْ أَضَلُّ سَبِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Or do you assume that most of them hear or understand? They are just like cattle, but even more errant in their way.

verses.verseString: أَلَمْ تَرَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَيْفَ مَدَّ الظِّلَّ وَلَوْ شَاءَ لَجَعَلَهُ سَاكِنًا ثُمَّ جَعَلْنَا الشَّمْسَ عَلَيْهِ دَلِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Do you not see how your Lord extends the shade? Had He willed, He could have made it stationary. And We made the sun a pointer to it.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ قَبَضْنَاهُ إِلَيْنَا قَبْضًا يَسِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Then We withdraw it towards Us, a gentle withdrawal.

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُمُ اللَّيْلَ لِبَاسًا وَالنَّوْمَ سُبَاتًا وَجَعَلَ النَّهَارَ نُشُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And it is He who made the night a covering for you—and sleep for rest. And He made the day a revival.

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي أَرْسَلَ الرِّيَاحَ بُشْرًا بَيْنَ يَدَيْ رَحْمَتِهِ ۚ وَأَنْزَلْنَا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ مَاءً طَهُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And it is He who sends the winds, ushering His mercy; and We send down from the sky pure water.

verses.verseString: لِنُحْيِيَ بِهِ بَلْدَةً مَيْتًا وَنُسْقِيَهُ مِمَّا خَلَقْنَا أَنْعَامًا وَأَنَاسِيَّ كَثِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: To revive dead lands thereby, and to provide drink for the multitude of animals and humans We created.

verses.verseString: وَلَقَدْ صَرَّفْنَاهُ بَيْنَهُمْ لِيَذَّكَّرُوا فَأَبَىٰ أَكْثَرُ النَّاسِ إِلَّا كُفُورًا
verses.verseStringB: We have circulated it among them, so that they may reflect, but most people persist in thanklessness.

verses.verseString: وَلَوْ شِئْنَا لَبَعَثْنَا فِي كُلِّ قَرْيَةٍ نَذِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Had We willed, We could have sent a warner to every town.

verses.verseString: فَلَا تُطِعِ الْكَافِرِينَ وَجَاهِدْهُمْ بِهِ جِهَادًا كَبِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: So do not obey the unbelievers, but strive against them with it, a grand struggle.

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي مَرَجَ الْبَحْرَيْنِ هَٰذَا عَذْبٌ فُرَاتٌ وَهَٰذَا مِلْحٌ أُجَاجٌ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَهُمَا بَرْزَخًا وَحِجْرًا مَحْجُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And it is He who merged the two seas: this one sweet and drinkable, and the other salty and bitter. And He placed between them a barrier and an impassable boundary.

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي خَلَقَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ بَشَرًا فَجَعَلَهُ نَسَبًا وَصِهْرًا ۗ وَكَانَ رَبُّكَ قَدِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And it is He who created the human being from a fluid, and made of him relationships through marriage and mating. Your Lord has always been Capable.

verses.verseString: وَيَعْبُدُونَ مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنْفَعُهُمْ وَلَا يَضُرُّهُمْ ۗ وَكَانَ الْكَافِرُ عَلَىٰ رَبِّهِ ظَهِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And yet, instead of Allah, they serve what can neither benefit them nor harm them. The unbeliever has always turned his back on his Lord.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَرْسَلْنَاكَ إِلَّا مُبَشِّرًا وَنَذِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: We sent you only as a deliverer of good news and a warner.

verses.verseString: قُلْ مَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ إِلَّا مَنْ شَاءَ أَنْ يَتَّخِذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِ سَبِيلًا
verses.verseStringB: Say, “I ask of you no payment for this—only that whoever wills may take a path to his Lord.”

verses.verseString: وَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى الْحَيِّ الَّذِي لَا يَمُوتُ وَسَبِّحْ بِحَمْدِهِ ۚ وَكَفَىٰ بِهِ بِذُنُوبِ عِبَادِهِ خَبِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: And put your trust in the Living, Who never dies; and celebrate His praises. Sufficient is He as the All-Informed Knower of the faults of His servants.

verses.verseString: الَّذِي خَلَقَ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضَ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٍ ثُمَّ اسْتَوَىٰ عَلَى الْعَرْشِ ۚ الرَّحْمَٰنُ فَاسْأَلْ بِهِ خَبِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: He who created the heavens and the earth and everything between them in six stages—then He settled on the Throne. The Most Merciful. Ask about Him a well-informed.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ اسْجُدُوا لِلرَّحْمَٰنِ قَالُوا وَمَا الرَّحْمَٰنُ أَنَسْجُدُ لِمَا تَأْمُرُنَا وَزَادَهُمْ نُفُورًا ۩
verses.verseStringB: And when it is said to them, “Prostrate before the Compassionate,” they say, “And what is the Compassionate? Are we to prostrate before whatever you command us?” And it increases them in aversion.

verses.verseString: تَبَارَكَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ فِي السَّمَاءِ بُرُوجًا وَجَعَلَ فِيهَا سِرَاجًا وَقَمَرًا مُنِيرًا
verses.verseStringB: Blessed is He who placed constellations in the sky—and placed in it a lamp, and a luminous moon.

verses.verseString: وَهُوَ الَّذِي جَعَلَ اللَّيْلَ وَالنَّهَارَ خِلْفَةً لِمَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَذَّكَّرَ أَوْ أَرَادَ شُكُورًا
verses.verseStringB: And it is He who made the night and the day successive—for whoever desires to reflect, or desires to show gratitude.

verses.verseString: وَعِبَادُ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الَّذِينَ يَمْشُونَ عَلَى الْأَرْضِ هَوْنًا وَإِذَا خَاطَبَهُمُ الْجَاهِلُونَ قَالُوا سَلَامًا
verses.verseStringB: The worshipers of the Gracious are those who walk on the earth modestly, and when the ignorant address them, they say, “Peace.”

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ يَبِيتُونَ لِرَبِّهِمْ سُجَّدًا وَقِيَامًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who pass the night before their Lord, prostrating and standing.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا اصْرِفْ عَنَّا عَذَابَ جَهَنَّمَ ۖ إِنَّ عَذَابَهَا كَانَ غَرَامًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who say, ‘‘Our Lord! Avert the suffering of Hell from us! Its suffering is continuous.

verses.verseString: إِنَّهَا سَاءَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
verses.verseStringB: It is a miserable residence and destination.”

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا أَنْفَقُوا لَمْ يُسْرِفُوا وَلَمْ يَقْتُرُوا وَكَانَ بَيْنَ ذَٰلِكَ قَوَامًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who, when they spend, are neither wasteful nor stingy, but choose a course in between.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَدْعُونَ مَعَ اللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا آخَرَ وَلَا يَقْتُلُونَ النَّفْسَ الَّتِي حَرَّمَ اللَّهُ إِلَّا بِالْحَقِّ وَلَا يَزْنُونَ ۚ وَمَنْ يَفْعَلْ ذَٰلِكَ يَلْقَ أَثَامًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who do not implore besides Allah any other god, and do not kill the soul which Allah has made sacred—except in the pursuit of justice—and do not commit adultery. Whoever does that will face penalties.

verses.verseString: يُضَاعَفْ لَهُ الْعَذَابُ يَوْمَ الْقِيَامَةِ وَيَخْلُدْ فِيهِ مُهَانًا
verses.verseStringB: The punishment will be multiplied for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will remain in it forever, humiliated.

verses.verseString: إِلَّا مَنْ تَابَ وَآمَنَ وَعَمِلَ عَمَلًا صَالِحًا فَأُولَٰئِكَ يُبَدِّلُ اللَّهُ سَيِّئَاتِهِمْ حَسَنَاتٍ ۗ وَكَانَ اللَّهُ غَفُورًا رَحِيمًا
verses.verseStringB: Except for those who repent, and believe, and perform righteous deeds. These—Allah will replace their bad deeds with good deeds. Allah is ever Forgiving, Most Merciful.

verses.verseString: وَمَنْ تَابَ وَعَمِلَ صَالِحًا فَإِنَّهُ يَتُوبُ إِلَى اللَّهِ مَتَابًا
verses.verseStringB: Whoever repents and acts righteously—has returned to Allah in repentance.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ لَا يَشْهَدُونَ الزُّورَ وَإِذَا مَرُّوا بِاللَّغْوِ مَرُّوا كِرَامًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who do not bear false witness, and when they come across indecencies, they pass by with dignity.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ إِذَا ذُكِّرُوا بِآيَاتِ رَبِّهِمْ لَمْ يَخِرُّوا عَلَيْهَا صُمًّا وَعُمْيَانًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who, when reminded of their Lord’s revelations, do not fall against them deaf and blind.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِينَ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا هَبْ لَنَا مِنْ أَزْوَاجِنَا وَذُرِّيَّاتِنَا قُرَّةَ أَعْيُنٍ وَاجْعَلْنَا لِلْمُتَّقِينَ إِمَامًا
verses.verseStringB: And those who say, “Our Lord! Give us comfort in our spouses and offspring. And make us a good example for the righteous.”

verses.verseString: أُولَٰئِكَ يُجْزَوْنَ الْغُرْفَةَ بِمَا صَبَرُوا وَيُلَقَّوْنَ فِيهَا تَحِيَّةً وَسَلَامًا
verses.verseStringB: It is they who will be awarded the Chamber for having persevered—and will be greeted there with salutations and peace.

verses.verseString: خَالِدِينَ فِيهَا ۚ حَسُنَتْ مُسْتَقَرًّا وَمُقَامًا
verses.verseStringB: Remaining in there forever—it is an excellent residence and destination.

verses.verseString: قُلْ مَا يَعْبَأُ بِكُمْ رَبِّي لَوْلَا دُعَاؤُكُمْ ۖ فَقَدْ كَذَّبْتُمْ فَسَوْفَ يَكُونُ لِزَامًا
verses.verseStringB: Say, “What weight would my Lord give you, were it not for your prayer? But you have denied, and it will be inevitable.”

verses.verseString: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: طسم
verses.verseStringB: Ta. Seen. Meem.

verses.verseString: تِلْكَ آيَاتُ الْكِتَابِ الْمُبِينِ
verses.verseStringB: These are the Verses of the Clarifying Book.

verses.verseString: لَعَلَّكَ بَاخِعٌ نَفْسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُوا مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Perhaps you will destroy yourself with grief: because they do not become believers.

verses.verseString: إِنْ نَشَأْ نُنَزِّلْ عَلَيْهِمْ مِنَ السَّمَاءِ آيَةً فَظَلَّتْ أَعْنَاقُهُمْ لَهَا خَاضِعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: If We will, We can send down upon them a sign from heaven, leaving their necks bent in submission to it.

verses.verseString: وَمَا يَأْتِيهِمْ مِنْ ذِكْرٍ مِنَ الرَّحْمَٰنِ مُحْدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُوا عَنْهُ مُعْرِضِينَ
verses.verseStringB: No fresh reminder comes to them from the Most Merciful, but they turn away from it.

verses.verseString: فَقَدْ كَذَّبُوا فَسَيَأْتِيهِمْ أَنْبَاءُ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ يَسْتَهْزِئُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They have lied; but soon will come to them the news of what they ridiculed.

verses.verseString: أَوَلَمْ يَرَوْا إِلَى الْأَرْضِ كَمْ أَنْبَتْنَا فِيهَا مِنْ كُلِّ زَوْجٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: Do they not see the earth, and how many beautiful pairs We produced in it?

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Most surely, your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: وَإِذْ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ ائْتِ الْقَوْمَ الظَّالِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: When your Lord called out to Moses, “Go to the tyrannical people.

verses.verseString: قَوْمَ فِرْعَوْنَ ۚ أَلَا يَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّي أَخَافُ أَنْ يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “My Lord, I fear they will reject me.

verses.verseString: وَيَضِيقُ صَدْرِي وَلَا يَنْطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرْسِلْ إِلَىٰ هَارُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And I become stressed, and my tongue is not fluent, so send Aaron too.

verses.verseString: وَلَهُمْ عَلَيَّ ذَنْبٌ فَأَخَافُ أَنْ يَقْتُلُونِ
verses.verseStringB: And they have a charge against me, so I fear they may kill me.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ فَاذْهَبَا بِآيَاتِنَا ۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُمْ مُسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “No. Go, both of you, with Our proofs. We are with you, listening.

verses.verseString: فَأْتِيَا فِرْعَوْنَ فَقُولَا إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Go to Pharaoh, and say, ‘We are messengers from the Lord of all Worlds.

verses.verseString: أَنْ أَرْسِلْ مَعَنَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.verseStringB: Let the Children of Israel go with us.'”

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَلَمْ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدًا وَلَبِثْتَ فِينَا مِنْ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you stayed among us for many of your years?

verses.verseString: وَفَعَلْتَ فَعْلَتَكَ الَّتِي فَعَلْتَ وَأَنْتَ مِنَ الْكَافِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And you committed that deed of yours, and you were ungrateful.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَعَلْتُهَا إِذًا وَأَنَا مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “I did it then—when I was misguided.

verses.verseString: فَفَرَرْتُ مِنْكُمْ لَمَّا خِفْتُكُمْ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكْمًا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And I fled from you when I feared you; but my Lord gave me wisdom, and He made me one of the messengers.

verses.verseString: وَتِلْكَ نِعْمَةٌ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنْ عَبَّدْتَ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.verseStringB: Is that the favor you taunt me with, although you have enslaved the Children of Israel?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فِرْعَوْنُ وَمَا رَبُّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Pharaoh said, “And what is the Lord of the Worlds?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبُّ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالْأَرْضِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ مُوقِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and everything between them—if you only knew.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ لِمَنْ حَوْلَهُ أَلَا تَسْتَمِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said to those around him, “Do you not hear?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبُّكُمْ وَرَبُّ آبَائِكُمُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Your Lord, and the Lord of your ancestors of old.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ الَّذِي أُرْسِلَ إِلَيْكُمْ لَمَجْنُونٌ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “This messenger of yours, who is sent to you, is crazy.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبُّ الْمَشْرِقِ وَالْمَغْرِبِ وَمَا بَيْنَهُمَا ۖ إِنْ كُنْتُمْ تَعْقِلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Lord of the East and the West, and everything between them—if you understand.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَئِنِ اتَّخَذْتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيْرِي لَأَجْعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ الْمَسْجُونِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “If you take any other god besides me, I will have you imprisoned.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَوَلَوْ جِئْتُكَ بِشَيْءٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “What if I bring you something convincing?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ فَأْتِ بِهِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Bring it—if what you say is true.”

verses.verseString: فَأَلْقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعْبَانٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: So he threw his cane; and it was a serpent, plain to see.

verses.verseString: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيْضَاءُ لِلنَّاظِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And he pulled his hand; and it was white, for all to see.

verses.verseString: قَالَ لِلْمَلَإِ حَوْلَهُ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَاحِرٌ عَلِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: He said to the dignitaries around him, “This is a skilled magician.

verses.verseString: يُرِيدُ أَنْ يُخْرِجَكُمْ مِنْ أَرْضِكُمْ بِسِحْرِهِ فَمَاذَا تَأْمُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He wants to expel you from your land with his magic, so what do you recommend?”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا أَرْجِهْ وَأَخَاهُ وَابْعَثْ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “Leave him and his brother for a while. And send recruiters to the cities.

verses.verseString: يَأْتُوكَ بِكُلِّ سَحَّارٍ عَلِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: To bring to you every experienced magician.”

verses.verseString: فَجُمِعَ السَّحَرَةُ لِمِيقَاتِ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ
verses.verseStringB: So the magicians assembled at the set time on the appointed day.

verses.verseString: وَقِيلَ لِلنَّاسِ هَلْ أَنْتُمْ مُجْتَمِعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And it was said to the people, “Would you come together?

verses.verseString: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ السَّحَرَةَ إِنْ كَانُوا هُمُ الْغَالِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So that we may follow the magicians: if they are the victors.”

verses.verseString: فَلَمَّا جَاءَ السَّحَرَةُ قَالُوا لِفِرْعَوْنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجْرًا إِنْ كُنَّا نَحْنُ الْغَالِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: When the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, “Is there a reward for us, if we are the winners?”

verses.verseString: قَالَ نَعَمْ وَإِنَّكُمْ إِذًا لَمِنَ الْمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Yes, and you will be among those closest to me.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ لَهُمْ مُوسَىٰ أَلْقُوا مَا أَنْتُمْ مُلْقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Moses said to them, “Present whatever you wish to present.”

verses.verseString: فَأَلْقَوْا حِبَالَهُمْ وَعِصِيَّهُمْ وَقَالُوا بِعِزَّةِ فِرْعَوْنَ إِنَّا لَنَحْنُ الْغَالِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So they threw their ropes and their sticks, and said, “By the majesty of Pharaoh, we will be the victors.”

verses.verseString: فَأَلْقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلْقَفُ مَا يَأْفِكُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Then Moses threw his cane, and it began swallowing their trickery.

verses.verseString: فَأُلْقِيَ السَّحَرَةُ سَاجِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And the magicians fell down, in prostration.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا آمَنَّا بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “We have believed in the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: رَبِّ مُوسَىٰ وَهَارُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The Lord of Moses and Aaron.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ آمَنْتُمْ لَهُ قَبْلَ أَنْ آذَنَ لَكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ الَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ السِّحْرَ فَلَسَوْفَ تَعْلَمُونَ ۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيْدِيَكُمْ وَأَرْجُلَكُمْ مِنْ خِلَافٍ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Did you believe in Him before I have given you permission? He must be your superior who taught you magic, but soon you will know. I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I crucify you all.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَا ضَيْرَ ۖ إِنَّا إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنْقَلِبُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “No problem. To our Lord, we will return.

verses.verseString: إِنَّا نَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَايَانَا أَنْ كُنَّا أَوَّلَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: We are eager for our Lord to forgive us our sins—since we are the first of the believers.”

verses.verseString: وَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنْ أَسْرِ بِعِبَادِي إِنَّكُمْ مُتَّبَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And We inspired Moses: “Travel with My servants at night, and you will be pursued.”

verses.verseString: فَأَرْسَلَ فِرْعَوْنُ فِي الْمَدَائِنِ حَاشِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then Pharaoh sent marshals to the cities.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ هَٰؤُلَاءِ لَشِرْذِمَةٌ قَلِيلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: “These are a small gang.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّهُمْ لَنَا لَغَائِظُونَ
verses.verseStringB: But they are offending us.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّا لَجَمِيعٌ حَاذِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And we are a vigilant multitude.”

verses.verseString: فَأَخْرَجْنَاهُمْ مِنْ جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.verseStringB: So We expelled them from gardens and springs.

verses.verseString: وَكُنُوزٍ وَمَقَامٍ كَرِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: And treasures, and splendid residences.

verses.verseString: كَذَٰلِكَ وَأَوْرَثْنَاهَا بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.verseStringB: So it was. And We awarded it to the Children of Israel.

verses.verseString: فَأَتْبَعُوهُمْ مُشْرِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And they followed them at sunrise.

verses.verseString: فَلَمَّا تَرَاءَى الْجَمْعَانِ قَالَ أَصْحَابُ مُوسَىٰ إِنَّا لَمُدْرَكُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When the two groups sighted one another, the companions of Moses said, “We are overtaken!”

verses.verseString: قَالَ كَلَّا ۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهْدِينِ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “No! My Lord is with me; He will guide me.”

verses.verseString: فَأَوْحَيْنَا إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ أَنِ اضْرِبْ بِعَصَاكَ الْبَحْرَ ۖ فَانْفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرْقٍ كَالطَّوْدِ الْعَظِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: And We inspired Moses: “Strike the sea with your cane.” And it parted. And each part was like a huge hill.

verses.verseString: وَأَزْلَفْنَا ثَمَّ الْآخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We drew the others near.

verses.verseString: وَأَنْجَيْنَا مُوسَىٰ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We drowned the others.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: وَاتْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ نَبَأَ إِبْرَاهِيمَ
verses.verseStringB: And relate to them the story of Abraham.

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوْمِهِ مَا تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When he said to his father and his people, “What are you worshiping?”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا نَعْبُدُ أَصْنَامًا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَاكِفِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “We worship idols, and we remain devoted to them.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ هَلْ يَسْمَعُونَكُمْ إِذْ تَدْعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Do they hear you when you pray?

verses.verseString: أَوْ يَنْفَعُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَضُرُّونَ
verses.verseStringB: Or do they benefit you, or harm you?”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا بَلْ وَجَدْنَا آبَاءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “But we found our ancestors doing so.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ أَفَرَأَيْتُمْ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “Have you considered what you worship.

verses.verseString: أَنْتُمْ وَآبَاؤُكُمُ الْأَقْدَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: You and your ancient ancestors?

verses.verseString: فَإِنَّهُمْ عَدُوٌّ لِي إِلَّا رَبَّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They are enemies to me, except the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: الَّذِي خَلَقَنِي فَهُوَ يَهْدِينِ
verses.verseStringB: He who created me, and guides me.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِي هُوَ يُطْعِمُنِي وَيَسْقِينِ
verses.verseStringB: He who feeds me, and gives me drink.

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا مَرِضْتُ فَهُوَ يَشْفِينِ
verses.verseStringB: And when I get sick, He heals me.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِي يُمِيتُنِي ثُمَّ يُحْيِينِ
verses.verseStringB: He who makes me die, and then revives me.

verses.verseString: وَالَّذِي أَطْمَعُ أَنْ يَغْفِرَ لِي خَطِيئَتِي يَوْمَ الدِّينِ
verses.verseStringB: And Who I hope will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment.”

verses.verseString: رَبِّ هَبْ لِي حُكْمًا وَأَلْحِقْنِي بِالصَّالِحِينَ
verses.verseStringB: “My Lord! Grant me wisdom, and join me with the righteous.

verses.verseString: وَاجْعَلْ لِي لِسَانَ صِدْقٍ فِي الْآخِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And give me a reputation of truth among the others.

verses.verseString: وَاجْعَلْنِي مِنْ وَرَثَةِ جَنَّةِ النَّعِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: And make me of those awarded the Garden of Bliss.

verses.verseString: وَاغْفِرْ لِأَبِي إِنَّهُ كَانَ مِنَ الضَّالِّينَ
verses.verseStringB: And forgive my father—he was one of the misguided.

verses.verseString: وَلَا تُخْزِنِي يَوْمَ يُبْعَثُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are resurrected.

verses.verseString: يَوْمَ لَا يَنْفَعُ مَالٌ وَلَا بَنُونَ
verses.verseStringB: The Day when neither wealth nor children can help.

verses.verseString: إِلَّا مَنْ أَتَى اللَّهَ بِقَلْبٍ سَلِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: Except for him who comes to Allah with a sound heart.”

verses.verseString: وَأُزْلِفَتِ الْجَنَّةُ لِلْمُتَّقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And the Garden will be brought near for the righteous.

verses.verseString: وَبُرِّزَتِ الْجَحِيمُ لِلْغَاوِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And the Blaze will be displayed to the deviators.

verses.verseString: وَقِيلَ لَهُمْ أَيْنَ مَا كُنْتُمْ تَعْبُدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And it will be said to them, “Where are those you used to worship?”

verses.verseString: مِنْ دُونِ اللَّهِ هَلْ يَنْصُرُونَكُمْ أَوْ يَنْتَصِرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Besides Allah? Can they help you, or help themselves?”

verses.verseString: فَكُبْكِبُوا فِيهَا هُمْ وَالْغَاوُونَ
verses.verseStringB: So they will be toppled into it, together with the seducers.

verses.verseString: وَجُنُودُ إِبْلِيسَ أَجْمَعُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And the soldiers of Iblis, all of them.

verses.verseString: قَالُوا وَهُمْ فِيهَا يَخْتَصِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They will say, as they feud in it.

verses.verseString: تَاللَّهِ إِنْ كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَالٍ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: “By Allah, We were in obvious error.

verses.verseString: إِذْ نُسَوِّيكُمْ بِرَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: For equating you with the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَضَلَّنَا إِلَّا الْمُجْرِمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And none misled us except the wicked.

verses.verseString: فَمَا لَنَا مِنْ شَافِعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Now we have no intercessors.

verses.verseString: وَلَا صَدِيقٍ حَمِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: And no true friend.

verses.verseString: فَلَوْ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةً فَنَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: If only we could have another chance, we would be of the believers.”

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ نُوحٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The people of Noah denied the messengers.

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When their brother Noah said to them, “Will you not be cautious?

verses.verseString: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: I ask of you no payment for this. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So reverence Allah, and obey me.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا أَنُؤْمِنُ لَكَ وَاتَّبَعَكَ الْأَرْذَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “Shall we believe in you? When the lowliest follow you.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ وَمَا عِلْمِي بِمَا كَانُوا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “What do I know about what they used to do?

verses.verseString: إِنْ حِسَابُهُمْ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّي ۖ لَوْ تَشْعُرُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Their reckoning is only with my Lord—if you have any sense.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَنَا بِطَارِدِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And I am not about to drive away the believers.

verses.verseString: إِنْ أَنَا إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ مُبِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: I am only a clear warner.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا نُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمَرْجُومِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “If you do not refrain, O Noah, you will be among the stoned.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنَّ قَوْمِي كَذَّبُونِ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “My Lord, my people have rejected me.

verses.verseString: فَافْتَحْ بَيْنِي وَبَيْنَهُمْ فَتْحًا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَنْ مَعِيَ مِنَ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So judge between me and them decisively. And save me, and the believers who are with me.

verses.verseString: فَأَنْجَيْنَاهُ وَمَنْ مَعَهُ فِي الْفُلْكِ الْمَشْحُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So We saved him and those with him in the fully loaded Ark.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ أَغْرَقْنَا بَعْدُ الْبَاقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then afterward We drowned the rest.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: كَذَّبَتْ عَادٌ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Aad disbelieved the messengers.

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When their brother Hud said to them, “Do you not fear?

verses.verseString: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: I am to you an honest messenger.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So reverence Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: I ask of you no payment for this. My payment is only from the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: أَتَبْنُونَ بِكُلِّ رِيعٍ آيَةً تَعْبَثُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Do you build a monument on every height for vanity's sake?

verses.verseString: وَتَتَّخِذُونَ مَصَانِعَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تَخْلُدُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And you construct fortresses, hoping to live forever?

verses.verseString: وَإِذَا بَطَشْتُمْ بَطَشْتُمْ جَبَّارِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And when you strike, you strike mercilessly?

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So reverence Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي أَمَدَّكُمْ بِمَا تَعْلَمُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And reverence Him who supplied you with everything you know.

verses.verseString: أَمَدَّكُمْ بِأَنْعَامٍ وَبَنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He supplied you with livestock and children.

verses.verseString: وَجَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.verseStringB: And gardens and springs.

verses.verseString: إِنِّي أَخَافُ عَلَيْكُمْ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: I fear for you the punishment of a terrible Day.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا سَوَاءٌ عَلَيْنَا أَوَعَظْتَ أَمْ لَمْ تَكُنْ مِنَ الْوَاعِظِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “It is the same for us, whether you lecture us, or do not lecture.

verses.verseString: إِنْ هَٰذَا إِلَّا خُلُقُ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: This is nothing but the morals of the ancients.

verses.verseString: وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And we are not to be punished.”

verses.verseString: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهْلَكْنَاهُمْ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So they denied him, so We destroyed them. There is a sign in this, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: كَذَّبَتْ ثَمُودُ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Thamood denied the messengers.

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ صَالِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When their brother Saleh said to them, “Do you not fear?

verses.verseString: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: I am a sincere messenger to you.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: I ask of you no payment for this. My reward is only from the Lord of the Universe.

verses.verseString: أَتُتْرَكُونَ فِي مَا هَاهُنَا آمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Will you be left secure in what is here?

verses.verseString: فِي جَنَّاتٍ وَعُيُونٍ
verses.verseStringB: In gardens and springs?

verses.verseString: وَزُرُوعٍ وَنَخْلٍ طَلْعُهَا هَضِيمٌ
verses.verseStringB: And plantations, and palm-trees with tender fruits?

verses.verseString: وَتَنْحِتُونَ مِنَ الْجِبَالِ بُيُوتًا فَارِهِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And you skillfully carve dwellings in the mountains?

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So reverence Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَلَا تُطِيعُوا أَمْرَ الْمُسْرِفِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And do not obey the command of the extravagant.

verses.verseString: الَّذِينَ يُفْسِدُونَ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
verses.verseStringB: Those who work corruption on earth, and do not reform.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “You are surely bewitched.

verses.verseString: مَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا فَأْتِ بِآيَةٍ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign, if you are truthful.

verses.verseString: قَالَ هَٰذِهِ نَاقَةٌ لَهَا شِرْبٌ وَلَكُمْ شِرْبُ يَوْمٍ مَعْلُومٍ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “This is a camel. She has her turn of drinking, and you have your turn of drinking—on a known day.

verses.verseString: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوءٍ فَيَأْخُذَكُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a tremendous day.”

verses.verseString: فَعَقَرُوهَا فَأَصْبَحُوا نَادِمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: But they hamstrung her, and they became full of remorse.

verses.verseString: فَأَخَذَهُمُ الْعَذَابُ ۗ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So the punishment seized them. Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: كَذَّبَتْ قَوْمُ لُوطٍ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The people of Lot rejected the messengers.

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ أَخُوهُمْ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When their brother Lot said to them, “Do you not fear?

verses.verseString: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: I am to you an honest messenger.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So fear Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: I ask of you no reward for it. My reward is only from the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: أَتَأْتُونَ الذُّكْرَانَ مِنَ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Do you approach the males of the world?

verses.verseString: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمْ رَبُّكُمْ مِنْ أَزْوَاجِكُمْ ۚ بَلْ أَنْتُمْ قَوْمٌ عَادُونَ
verses.verseStringB: And forsake the wives your Lord created for you? Indeed, you are intrusive people.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا لَئِنْ لَمْ تَنْتَهِ يَا لُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ الْمُخْرَجِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “Unless you refrain, O Lot, you will be expelled.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ إِنِّي لِعَمَلِكُمْ مِنَ الْقَالِينَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “I deplore what you do.”

verses.verseString: رَبِّ نَجِّنِي وَأَهْلِي مِمَّا يَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: “My Lord! Save me and my family from what they do.”

verses.verseString: فَنَجَّيْنَاهُ وَأَهْلَهُ أَجْمَعِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So We saved him and his family, all together.

verses.verseString: إِلَّا عَجُوزًا فِي الْغَابِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Except for an old woman among those who lagged behind.

verses.verseString: ثُمَّ دَمَّرْنَا الْآخَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Then We destroyed the others.

verses.verseString: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِمْ مَطَرًا ۖ فَسَاءَ مَطَرُ الْمُنْذَرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And We rained down on them a rain. Dreadful is the rain of those forewarned.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: كَذَّبَ أَصْحَابُ الْأَيْكَةِ الْمُرْسَلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: The inhabitants of the Woods denied the messengers.

verses.verseString: إِذْ قَالَ لَهُمْ شُعَيْبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.verseStringB: When Shuaib said to them, “Do you not fear?

verses.verseString: إِنِّي لَكُمْ رَسُولٌ أَمِينٌ
verses.verseStringB: I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

verses.verseString: فَاتَّقُوا اللَّهَ وَأَطِيعُونِ
verses.verseStringB: So be cautious of Allah, and obey me.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَسْأَلُكُمْ عَلَيْهِ مِنْ أَجْرٍ ۖ إِنْ أَجْرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: I ask of you no payment for this. My payment is only from the Lord of the Universe.

verses.verseString: أَوْفُوا الْكَيْلَ وَلَا تَكُونُوا مِنَ الْمُخْسِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Give full measure. And do not cheat.

verses.verseString: وَزِنُوا بِالْقِسْطَاسِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِ
verses.verseStringB: And weigh with accurate scales.

verses.verseString: وَلَا تَبْخَسُوا النَّاسَ أَشْيَاءَهُمْ وَلَا تَعْثَوْا فِي الْأَرْضِ مُفْسِدِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And do not defraud people of their belongings. And do not spread corruption in the land.

verses.verseString: وَاتَّقُوا الَّذِي خَلَقَكُمْ وَالْجِبِلَّةَ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And reverence Him who created you and the masses of old.”

verses.verseString: قَالُوا إِنَّمَا أَنْتَ مِنَ الْمُسَحَّرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: They said, “You are one of the bewitched.

verses.verseString: وَمَا أَنْتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٌ مِثْلُنَا وَإِنْ نَظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ الْكَاذِبِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And you are nothing but a human like us, and we think you are a liar.

verses.verseString: فَأَسْقِطْ عَلَيْنَا كِسَفًا مِنَ السَّمَاءِ إِنْ كُنْتَ مِنَ الصَّادِقِينَ
verses.verseStringB: So bring down on us pieces from the sky, if you are truthful.”

verses.verseString: قَالَ رَبِّي أَعْلَمُ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ
verses.verseStringB: He said, “My Lord is Well Aware of what you do.”

verses.verseString: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمْ عَذَابُ يَوْمِ الظُّلَّةِ ۚ إِنَّهُ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.verseStringB: So they denied him. So the punishment of the day of gloom gripped them. It was the punishment of a tremendous day.

verses.verseString: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَآيَةً ۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكْثَرُهُمْ مُؤْمِنِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Surely in this is a sign, but most of them are not believers.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَهُوَ الْعَزِيزُ الرَّحِيمُ
verses.verseStringB: Your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّهُ لَتَنْزِيلُ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.

verses.verseString: نَزَلَ بِهِ الرُّوحُ الْأَمِينُ
verses.verseStringB: The Honest Spirit came down with it.

verses.verseString: عَلَىٰ قَلْبِكَ لِتَكُونَ مِنَ الْمُنْذِرِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Upon your heart, so that you may be of the Warners.

verses.verseString: بِلِسَانٍ عَرَبِيٍّ مُبِينٍ
verses.verseStringB: In a clear Arabic language.

verses.verseString: وَإِنَّهُ لَفِي زُبُرِ الْأَوَّلِينَ
verses.verseStringB: And it is in the scriptures of the ancients.

verses.verseString: أَوَلَمْ يَكُنْ لَهُمْ آيَةً أَنْ يَعْلَمَهُ عُلَمَاءُ بَنِي إِسْرَائِيلَ
verses.verseStringB: Is it not a sign for them that it was recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

verses.verseString: وَلَوْ نَزَّلْنَاهُ عَلَىٰ بَعْضِ الْأَعْجَمِينَ
verses.verseStringB: Had We revealed it to one of the foreigners.

verses.verseString: فَقَرَأَهُ عَلَيْهِمْ مَا كَانُوا بِهِ مُؤْمِنِينَ
